intro: Tulipa laciniata, commonly known as the shaggy tulip, is a species of flowering plant in the family Liliaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, fringed petals that give it a feathery appearance. Native to Central Asia, this perennial bulbous plant thrives in well-drained soils and full sun. The flowers typically bloom in spring, displaying shades of red, orange, and yellow. Its unique morphology and vibrant colors make it a popular choice for garden cultivation.
